Raag Sorat'h − Part 001 595 : 1 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 595 : 2 Sorat'h, First Mehl, First House, Chau−Padas: 595 : 3 Death comes to all, and all must suffer separation. 595 : 4 Go and ask the clever people, whether they shall meet in the world hereafter. 595 : 5 Those who forget my Lord and Master shall suffer in terrible pain. ||1|| 595 : 6 So praise the True Lord, 595 : 7 by whose Grace peace ever prevails. ||Pause|| 595 : 8 Praise Him as great; He is, and He shall ever be. 595 : 9 You alone are the Great Giver; mankind cannot give anything. 2

595 : 10 Whatever pleases Him, comes to pass; what good does it do to cry out in protest? ||2|| 595 : 11 Many have proclaimed their sovereignty over millions of fortresses on the earth, but they have now departed. 595 : 12 And those, whom even the sky could not contain, had ropes put through their noses. 595 : 13 O mind, if you only knew the torment in your future, you would not relish the sweet pleasures of the present. ||3|| 595 : 14 O Nanak, as many as are the sins one commits, so many are the chains around his neck. 595 : 15 If he possesses virtues, then the chains are cut away; these virtues are his brothers, his true brothers. 595 : 16 Going to the world hereafter, those who have no Guru are not accepted; they are beaten, and expelled. ||4||1|| 595 : 17 Sorat'h, First Mehl, First House: 595 : 18 Make your mind the farmer, good deeds the farm, modesty the water, and your body the field. Raag Sorat'h − Part 001 3

595 : 19 Let the Lord's Name be the seed, contentment the plow, and your humble dress the fence. 595 : 20 Doing deeds of love, the seed shall sprout, and you shall see your home flourish. ||1|| 595 : 21 O Baba, the wealth of Maya does not go with anyone. 595 : 22 This Maya has bewitched the world, but only a rare few understand this. ||Pause|| 595 : 23 Make your ever−decreasing life your shop, and make the Lord's Name your merchandise. 595 : 24 Make understanding and contemplation your warehouse, and in that warehouse, store the Lord's Name. 595 : 25 Deal with the Lord's dealers, earn your profits, and rejoice in your mind. ||2|| 595 : 26 Let your trade be listening to scripture, and let Truth be the horses you take to sell. 595 : 27 Gather up merits for your travelling expenses, and do not think of tomorrow in your mind. 595 : 28 When you arrive in the land of the Formless Lord, you shall find peace in the Mansion of Raag Sorat'h − Part 001 4

His Presence. ||3|| 595 : 29 Let your service be the focusing of your consciousness, and let your occupation be the placing of faith in the Naam. −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 001 −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 001 5

Raag Sorat'h − Part 002 596 : 30 Let your work be restraint from sin; only then will people call you blessed. 596 : 31 O Nanak, the Lord shall look upon you with His Glance of Grace, and you shall be blessed with honor four times over. ||4||2|| 596 : 32 Sorat'h, First Mehl, Chau−Tukas: 596 : 33 The son is dear to his mother and father; he is the wise son−in−law to his father−in−law. 596 : 34 The father is dear to his son and daughter, and the brother is very dear to his brother. 596 : 35 By the Order of the Lord's Command, he leaves his house and goes outside, and in an instant, everything becomes alien to him. 596 : 36 The self−willed manmukh does not remember the Name of the Lord, does not give in charity, and does not cleanse his consciousness; his body rolls in the dust. ||1|| 596 : 37 The mind is comforted by the Comforter of the Naam. 596 : 38 6

I fall at the Guru's feet − I am a sacrifice to Him; He has given me to understand the true understanding. ||Pause|| 596 : 39 The mind is impressed with the false love of the world; he quarrels with the Lord's humble servant. 596 : 40 Infatuated with Maya, night and day, he sees only the worldly path; he does not chant the Naam, and drinking poison, he dies. 596 : 41 He is imbued and infatuated with vicious talk; the Word of the Shabad does not come into his consciousness. 596 : 42 He is not imbued with the Lord's Love, and he is not impressed by the taste of the Name; the self−willed manmukh loses his honor. ||2|| 596 : 43 He does not enjoy celestial peace in the Company of the Holy, and there is not even a bit of sweetness on his tongue. 596 : 44 He calls his mind, body and wealth his own; he has no knowledge of the Court of the Lord. 596 : 45 Closing his eyes, he walks in darkness; he cannot see the home of his own being, O Siblings of Destiny. 596 : 46 Tied up at Death's door, he finds no place of rest; he receives the rewards of his own actions. ||3|| Raag Sorat'h − Part 002 7

596 : 47 When the Lord casts His Glance of Grace, then I see Him with my own eyes; He is indescribable, and cannot be described. 596 : 48 With my ears, I continually listen to the Word of the Shabad, and I praise Him; His Ambrosial Name abides within my heart. 596 : 49 He is Fearless, Formless and absolutely without vengeance; I am absorbed in His Perfect Light. 596 : 50 O Nanak, without the Guru, doubt is not dispelled; through the True Name, glorious greatness is obtained. ||4||3|| 596 : 51 Sorat'h, First Mehl, Du−Tukas: 596 : 52 In the realm of land, and in the realm of water, Your seat is the chamber of the four directions. 596 : 53 Yours is the one and only form of the entire universe; Your mouth is the mint to fashion all. ||1|| 596 : 54 O my Lord Master, Your play is so wonderful! 596 : 55 Raag Sorat'h − Part 002 8

You are pervading and permeating the water, the land and the sky; You Yourself are contained in all. ||Pause|| 596 : 56 Wherever I look, there I see Your Light, but what is Your form? 596 : 57 You have one form, but it is unseen; there is none like any other. ||2|| 596 : 58 The beings born of eggs, born of the womb, born of the earth and born of sweat, all are created by You. 596 : 59 I have seen one glory of Yours, that You are pervading and permeating in all. ||3|| 596 : 60 Your Glories are so numerous, and I do not know even one of them; I am such a fool − please, give me some of them! 596 : 61 Prays Nanak, listen, O my Lord Master: I am sinking like a stone − please, save me! ||4||4|| 596 : 62 Sorat'h, First Mehl: 596 : 63 I am a wicked sinner and a great hypocrite; You are the Immaculate and Formless Lord. 596 : 64 Raag Sorat'h − Part 002 9

Tasting the Ambrosial Nectar, I am imbued with supreme bliss; O Lord and Master, I seek Your Sanctuary. ||1|| 596 : 65 O Creator Lord, You are the honor of the dishonored. 596 : 66 In my lap is the honor and glory of the wealth of the Name; I merge into the True Word of the Shabad. ||Pause|| 596 : 67 You are perfect, while I am worthless and imperfect. You are profound, while I am trivial. −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 002 −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 002 10

Raag Sorat'h − Part 003 597 : 68 My mind is imbued with You, day and night and morning, O Lord; my tongue chants Your Name, and my mind meditates on You. ||2|| 597 : 69 You are True, and I am absorbed into You; through the mystery of the Shabad, I shall ultimately become True as well. 597 : 70 Those who are imbued with the Naam day and night are pure, while those who die to be reborn are impure. ||3|| 597 : 71 I do not see any other like the Lord; who else should I praise? No one is equal to Him. 597 : 72 Prays Nanak, I am the slave of His slaves; by Guru's Instruction, I know Him. ||4||5|| 597 : 73 Sorat'h, First Mehl: 597 : 74 He is unknowable, infinite, unapproachable and imperceptible. He is not subject to death or karma. 597 : 75 His caste is casteless; He is unborn, self−illumined, and free of doubt and desire. ||1|| 597 : 76 11

I am a sacrifice to the Truest of the True. 597 : 77 He has no form, no color and no features; through the True Word of the Shabad, He reveals Himself. ||Pause|| 597 : 78 He has no mother, father, sons or relatives; He is free of sexual desire; He has no wife. 597 : 79 He has no ancestry; He is immaculate. He is infinite and endless; O Lord, Your Light is pervading all. ||2|| 597 : 80 Deep within each and every heart, God is hidden; His Light is in each and every heart. 597 : 81 The heavy doors are opened by Guru's Instructions; one becomes fearless, in the trance of deep meditation. ||3|| 597 : 82 The Lord created all beings, and placed death over the heads of all; all the world is under His Power. 597 : 83 Serving the True Guru, the treasure is obtained; living the Word of the Shabad, one is emancipated. ||4|| 597 : 84 In the pure vessel, the True Name is contained; how few are those who practice true conduct. Raag Sorat'h − Part 003 12

597 : 85 The individual soul is united with the Supreme Soul; Nanak seeks Your Sanctuary, Lord. ||5||6|| 597 : 86 Sorat'h, First Mehl: 597 : 87 Like a fish without water is the faithless cynic, who dies of thirst. 597 : 88 So shall you die, O mind, without the Lord, as your breath goes in vain. ||1|| 597 : 89 O mind, chant the Lord's Name, and praise Him. 597 : 90 Without the Guru, how will you obtain this juice? The Guru shall unite you with the Lord. ||Pause|| 597 : 91 For the Gurmukh, meeting with the Society of the Saints is like making a pilgrimage to a sacred shrine. 597 : 92 The benefit of bathing at the sixty−eight sacred shrines of pilgrimage is obtained by the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan. ||2|| 597 : 93 Like the Yogi without abstinence, and like penance without truth and contentment, Raag Sorat'h − Part 003 13

597 : 94 so is the body without the Lord's Name; death will slay it, because of the sin within. ||3|| 597 : 95 The faithless cynic does not obtain the Lord's Love; the Lord's Love is obtained only through the True Guru. 597 : 96 One who meets with the Guru, the Giver of pleasure and pain, says Nanak, is absorbed in the Lord's Praise. ||4||7|| 597 : 97 Sorat'h, First Mehl: 597 : 98 You, God, are the Giver of gifts, the Lord of perfect understanding; I am a mere beggar at Your Door. 597 : 99 What should I beg for? Nothing remains permanent; O Lord, please, bless me with Your Beloved Name. ||1|| 597 : 100 In each and every heart, the Lord, the Lord of the forest, is permeating and pervading. 597 : 101 In the water, on the land, and in the sky, He is pervading but hidden; through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, He is revealed. ||Pause|| 597 : 102 In this world, in the nether regions of the underworld, and in the Akaashic Ethers, the Guru, the True Guru, has shown me the Lord; He has showered me with His Mercy. Raag Sorat'h − Part 003 14
597 : 103 He is the unborn Lord God; He is, and shall ever be. Deep within your heart, behold Him, the Destroyer of ego. ||2|| −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 003 −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 003 15

Raag Sorat'h − Part 004 598 : 104 This wretched world is caught in birth and death; in the love of duality, it has forgotten devotional worship of the Lord. 598 : 105 Meeting the True Guru, the Guru's Teachings are obtained; the faithless cynic loses the game of life. ||3|| 598 : 106 Breaking my bonds, the True Guru has set me free, and I shall not be cast into the womb of reincarnation again. 598 : 107 O Nanak, the jewel of spiritual wisdom shines forth, and the Lord, the Formless Lord, dwells within my mind. ||4||8|| 598 : 108 Sorat'h, First Mehl: 598 : 109 The treasure of the Name, for which you have come into the world − that Ambrosial Nectar is with the Guru. 598 : 110 Renounce costumes, disguises and clever tricks; this fruit is not obtained by duplicity. ||1|| 598 : 111 O my mind, remain steady, and do not wander away. 16

598 : 112 By searching around on the outside, you shall only suffer great pain; the Ambrosial Nectar is found within the home of your own being. ||Pause|| 598 : 113 Renounce corruption, and seek virtue; committing sins, you shall only come to regret and repent. 598 : 114 You do not know the difference between good and evil; again and again, you sink into the mud. ||2|| 598 : 115 Within you is the great filth of greed and falsehood; why do you bother to wash your body on the outside? 598 : 116 Chant the Immaculate Naam, the Name of the Lord always, under Guru's Instruction; only then will your innermost being be emancipated. ||3|| 598 : 117 Let greed and slander be far away from you, and renounce falsehood; through the True Word of the Guru's Shabad, you shall obtain the true fruit. 598 : 118 As it pleases You, You preserve me, Dear Lord; servant Nanak sings the Praises of Your Shabad. ||4||9|| 598 : 119 Sorat'h, First Mehl, Panch−Padas: 598 : 120 Raag Sorat'h − Part 004 17

You cannot save your own home from being plundered; why do you spy on the houses of others? 598 : 121 That Gurmukh who joins himself to the Guru's service, saves his own home, and tastes the Lord's Nectar. ||1|| 598 : 122 O mind, you must realize what your intellect is focused on. 598 : 123 Forgetting the Naam, the Name of the Lord, one is involved with other tastes; the unfortunate wretch shall come to regret it in the end. ||Pause|| 598 : 124 When things come, he is pleased, but when they go, he weeps and wails; this pain and pleasure remains attached to him. 598 : 125 The Lord Himself causes him to enjoy pleasure and endure pain; the Gurmukh, however, remains unaffected. ||2|| 598 : 126 What else can be said to be above the subtle essence of the Lord? One who drinks it in is satisfied and satiated. 598 : 127 One who is lured by Maya loses this juice; that faithless cynic is tied to his evil−mindedness. ||3|| 598 : 128 The Lord is the life of the mind, the Master of the breath of life; the Divine Lord is contained in the body. Raag Sorat'h − Part 004 18

598 : 129 If You so bless us, Lord, then we sing Your Praises; the mind is satisfied and fulfilled, lovingly attached to the Lord. ||4|| 598 : 130 In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, the subtle essence of the Lord is obtained; meeting the Guru, the fear of death departs. 598 : 131 O Nanak, chant the Name of the Lord, as Gurmukh; you shall obtain the Lord, and realize your pre−ordained destiny. ||5||10|| 598 : 132 Sorat'h, First Mehl: 598 : 133 Destiny, pre−ordained by the Lord, looms over the heads of all beings; no one is without this pre−ordained destiny. 598 : 134 Only He Himself is beyond destiny; creating the creation by His creative power, He beholds it, and causes His Command to be followed. ||1|| 598 : 135 O mind, chant the Name of the Lord, and be at peace. 598 : 136 Day and night, serve at the Guru's feet; the Lord is the Giver, and the Enjoyer. ||Pause|| −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 004 −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 004 19

Raag Sorat'h − Part 005 599 : 137 He is within − see Him outside as well; there is no one, other than Him. 599 : 138 As Gurmukh, look upon all with the single eye of equality; in each and every heart, the Divine Light is contained. ||2|| 599 : 139 Restrain your fickle mind, and keep it steady within its own home; meeting the Guru, this understanding is obtained. 599 : 140 Seeing the unseen Lord, you shall be amazed and delighted; forgetting your pain, you shall be at peace. ||3|| 599 : 141 Drinking in the ambrosial nectar, you shall attain the highest bliss, and dwell within the home of your own self. 599 : 142 So sing the Praises of the Lord, the Destroyer of the fear of birth and death, and you shall not be reincarnated again. ||4|| 599 : 143 The essence, the immaculate Lord, the Light of all − I am He and He is me − there is no difference between us. 599 : 144 The Infinite Transcendent Lord, the Supreme Lord God − Nanak has met with Him, the Guru. ||5||11|| 20

599 : 145 Sorat'h, First Mehl, Third House: 599 : 146 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 599 : 147 When I am pleasing to Him, then I sing His Praises. 599 : 148 Singing His Praises, I receive the fruits of my rewards. 599 : 149 The rewards of singing His Praises are obtained when He Himself gives them. ||1|| 599 : 150 O my mind, through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, the treasure is obtained; 599 : 151 this is why I remain immersed in the True Name. ||Pause|| 599 : 152 When I awoke within myself to the Guru's Teachings, 599 : 153 then I renounced my fickle intellect. 599 : 154 When the Light of the Guru's Teachings dawned, Raag Sorat'h − Part 005 21

599 : 155 and then all darkness was dispelled. ||2|| 599 : 156 When the mind is attached to the Guru's Feet, 599 : 157 then the Path of Death recedes. 599 : 158 Through the Fear of God, one attains the Fearless Lord; 599 : 159 then, one enters the home of celestial bliss. ||3|| 599 : 160 Prays Nanak, how rare are those who reflect and understand, 599 : 161 the most sublime action in this world. 599 : 162 The noblest deed is to sing the Lord's Praises, 599 : 163 and so meet the Lord Himself. ||4||1||12|| 599 : 164 Sorat'h, Third Mehl, First House: Raag Sorat'h − Part 005 22

599 : 165 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 599 : 166 All of Your servants, who relish the Word of Your Shabad, serve You. 599 : 167 By Guru's Grace, they become pure, eradicating self−conceit from within. 599 : 168 Night and day, they continually sing the Glorious Praises of the True Lord; they are adorned with the Word of the Guru's Shabad. ||1|| 599 : 169 O my Lord and Master, I am Your child; I seek Your Sanctuary. 599 : 170 You are the One and Only Lord, the Truest of the True; You Yourself are the Destroyer of ego. ||Pause|| 599 : 171 Those who remain wakeful obtain God; through the Word of the Shabad, they conquer their ego. 599 : 172 Immersed in family life, the Lord's humble servant ever remains detached; he reflects upon the essence of spiritual wisdom. 599 : 173 Serving the True Guru, he finds eternal peace, and he keeps the Lord enshrined in his heart. ||2|| Raag Sorat'h − Part 005 23
599 : 174 This mind wanders in the ten directions; it is consumed by the love of duality. −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 005 −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 005 24

Raag Sorat'h − Part 006 600 : 175 The foolish self−willed manmukh does not remember the Lord's Name; he wastes away his life in vain. 600 : 176 But when he meets the True Guru, then he obtains the Name; he sheds egotism and emotional attachment. ||3|| 600 : 177 The Lord's humble servants are True − they practice Truth, and reflect upon the Word of the Guru's Shabad. 600 : 178 The True Lord God unites them with Himself, and they keep the True Lord enshrined in their hearts. 600 : 179 O Nanak, through the Name, I have obtained salvation and understanding; this alone is my wealth. ||4||1|| 600 : 180 Sorat'h, Third Mehl: 600 : 181 The True Lord has blessed His devotees with the treasure of devotional worship, and the wealth of the Lord's Name. 600 : 182 The wealth of the Naam, shall never be exhausted; no one can estimate its worth. 25

600 : 183 With the wealth of the Naam, their faces are radiant, and they attain the True Lord. ||1|| 600 : 184 O my mind, through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, the Lord is found. 600 : 185 Without the Shabad, the world wanders around, and receives its punishment in the Court of the Lord. ||Pause|| 600 : 186 Within this body dwell the five thieves: sexual desire, anger, greed, emotional attachment and egotism. 600 : 187 They plunder the Nectar, but the self−willed manmukh does not realize it; no one hears his complaint. 600 : 188 The world is blind, and its dealings are blind as well; without the Guru, there is only pitch darkness. ||2|| 600 : 189 Indulging in egotism and possessiveness, they are ruined; when they depart, nothing goes along with them. 600 : 190 But one who becomes Gurmukh meditates on the Naam, and ever contemplates the Lord's Name. 600 : 191 Raag Sorat'h − Part 006 26

Through the True Word of Gurbani, he sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord; blessed with the Lord's Glance of Grace, he is enraptured. ||3|| 600 : 192 The spiritual wisdom of the True Guru is a steady light within the heart. The Lord's decree is over the heads of even kings. 600 : 193 Night and day, the Lord's devotees worship Him; night and day, they gather in the true profit of the Lord's Name. 600 : 194 O Nanak, through the Lord's Name, one is emancipated; attuned to the Shabad, he finds the Lord. ||4||2|| 600 : 195 Sorat'h, Third Mehl: 600 : 196 If one becomes the slave of the Lord's slaves, then he finds the Lord, and eradicates ego from within. 600 : 197 The Lord of bliss is his object of devotion; night and day, he sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 600 : 198 Attuned to the Word of the Shabad, the Lord's devotees remain ever as one, absorbed in the Lord. ||1|| 600 : 199 O Dear Lord, Your Glance of Grace is True. Raag Sorat'h − Part 006 27

600 : 200 Show mercy to Your slave, O Beloved Lord, and preserve my honor. ||Pause|| 600 : 201 Continually praising the Word of the Shabad, I live; under Guru's Instruction, my fear has been dispelled. 600 : 202 My True Lord God is so beautiful! Serving the Guru, my consciousness is focused on Him. 600 : 203 One who chants the True Word of the Shabad, and the Truest of the True, the Word of His Bani, remains wakeful, day and night. ||2|| 600 : 204 He is so very deep and profound, the Giver of eternal peace; no one can find His limit. 600 : 205 Serving the Perfect Guru, one becomes carefree, enshrining the Lord within the mind. 600 : 206 The mind and body become immaculately pure, and a lasting peace fills the heart; doubt is eradicated from within. ||3|| 600 : 207 The Way of the Lord is always such a difficult path; only a few find it, contemplating the Guru. 600 : 208 Imbued with the Lord's Love, and intoxicated with the Shabad, he renounces ego and corruption. Raag Sorat'h − Part 006 28
600 : 209 O Nanak, imbued with the Naam, and the Love of the One Lord, he is embellished with the Word of the Shabad. ||4||3|| −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 006 −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 006 29

Raag Sorat'h − Part 007 601 : 210 Sorat'h, Third Mehl: 601 : 211 Dear Beloved Lord, I praise You continually, as long as there is the breath within my body. 601 : 212 If I were to forget You, for a moment, even for an instant, O Lord Master, it would be like fifty years for me. 601 : 213 I was always such a fool and an idiot, O Siblings of Destiny, but now, through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, my mind is enlightened. ||1|| 601 : 214 Dear Lord, You Yourself bestow understanding. 601 : 215 Dear Lord, I am forever a sacrifice to You; I am dedicated and devoted to Your Name. ||Pause|| 601 : 216 I have died in the Word of the Shabad, and through the Shabad, I am dead while yet alive, O Siblings of Destiny; through the Shabad, I have been liberated. 601 : 217 Through the Shabad, my mind and body have been purified, and the Lord has come to dwell within my mind. 30

601 : 218 The Guru is the Giver of the Shabad; my mind is imbued with it, and I remain absorbed in the Lord. ||2|| 601 : 219 Those who do not know the Shabad are blind and deaf; why did they even bother to come into the world? 601 : 220 They do not obtain the subtle essence of the Lord's elixir; they waste away their lives, and are reincarnated over and over again. 601 : 221 The blind, idiotic, self−willed manmukhs are like maggots in manure, and in manure they rot away. ||3|| 601 : 222 The Lord Himself creates us, watches over us, and places us on the Path, O Siblings of Destiny; there is no one other than Him. 601 : 223 No one can erase that which is pre−ordained, O Siblings of Destiny; whatever the Creator wills, comes to pass. 601 : 224 O Nanak, the Naam, the Name of the Lord, abides deep within the mind; O Siblings of Destiny, there is no other at all. ||4||4|| 601 : 225 Sorat'h, Third Mehl: 601 : 226 Raag Sorat'h − Part 007 31

The Gurmukhs practice devotional worship, and become pleasing to God; night and day, they chant the Naam, the Name of the Lord. 601 : 227 You Yourself protect and take care of Your devotees, who are pleasing to Your Mind. 601 : 228 You are the Giver of virtue, realized through the Word of Your Shabad. Uttering Your Glories, we merge with You, O Glorious Lord. ||1|| 601 : 229 O my mind, remember always the Dear Lord. 601 : 230 At the very last moment, He alone shall be your best friend; He shall always stand by you. ||Pause|| 601 : 231 The gathering of the wicked enemies shall always practice falsehood; they do not contemplate understanding. 601 : 232 Who can obtain fruit from the slander of evil enemies? Remember that Harnaakhash was torn apart by the Lord's claws. 601 : 233 Prahlaad, the Lord's humble servant, constantly sang the Glorious Praises of the Lord, and the Dear Lord saved him. ||2|| 601 : 234 The self−willed manmukhs see themselves as being very virtuous; they have absolutely no understanding at all. Raag Sorat'h − Part 007 32

601 : 235 They indulge in slander of the humble spiritual people; they waste their lives away, and then they have to depart. 601 : 236 They never think of the Lord's Name, and in the end, they depart, regretting and repenting. ||3|| 601 : 237 The Lord makes the lives of His devotees fruitful; He Himself links them to the Guru's service. 601 : 238 Imbued with the Word of the Shabad, and intoxicated with celestial bliss, night and day, they sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 601 : 239 Slave Nanak utters this prayer: O Lord, please, let me fall at their feet. ||4||5|| 601 : 240 Sorat'h, Third Mehl: 601 : 241 He alone is a Sikh, a friend, a relative and a sibling, who walks in the Way of the Guru's Will. 601 : 242 One who walks according to his own will, O Siblings of Destiny, suffers separation from the Lord, and shall be punished. 601 : 243 Raag Sorat'h − Part 007 33

Without the True Guru, peace is never obtained, O Siblings of Destiny; again and again, he regrets and repents. ||1|| 601 : 244 The Lord's slaves are happy, O Siblings of Destiny. −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 007 −− Raag Sorat'h − Part 007 34

Raag Sorat'h − Part 008 602 : 245 The sins and sorrows of countless lifetimes are eradicated; the Lord Himself unites them in His Union. ||Pause|| 602 : 246 All of these relatives are like chains upon the soul, O Siblings of Destiny; the world is deluded by doubt. 602 : 247 Without the Guru, the chains cannot be broken; the Gurmukhs find the door of salvation. 602 : 248 One who performs rituals without realizing the Word of the Guru's Shabad, shall die and be reborn, again and again. ||2|| 602 : 249 The world is entangled in egotism and possessiveness, O Siblings of Destiny, but no one belongs to anyone else. 602 : 250 The Gurmukhs attain the Mansion of the Lord's Presence, singing the Glories of the Lord; they dwell in the home of their own inner being. 602 : 251 One who understands here, realizes himself; the Lord God belongs to him. ||3|| 602 : 252 The True Guru is forever merciful, O Siblings of Destiny; without good destiny, what can anyone obtain? 35

602 : 253 He looks alike upon all with His Glance of Grace, but people receive the fruits of their rewards according to their love for the Lord. 602 : 254 O Nanak, when the Naam, the Name of the Lord, comes to dwell within the mind, then self−conceit is eradicated from within. ||4||6|| 602 : 255 Sorat'h, Third Mehl, Chau−Tukas: 602 : 256 True devotional worship is obtained only through the True Guru, when the True Word of His Bani is in the heart. 602 : 257 Serving the True Guru, eternal peace is obtained; egotism is obliterated through the Word of the Shabad. 602 : 258 Without the Guru, there is no true devotion; otherwise, people wander around, deluded by ignorance. 602 : 259 The self−willed manmukhs wander around, suffering in constant pain; they drown and die, even without water. ||1|| 602 : 260 O Siblings of Destiny, remain forever in the Lord's Sanctuary, under His Protection. 602 : 261 Raag Sorat'h − Part 008 36

Bestowing His Glance of Grace, He preserves our honor, and blesses us with the glory of the Lord's Name. ||Pause|| 602 : 262 Through the Perfect Guru, one comes to understand himself, contemplating the True Word of the Shabad. 602 : 263 The Lord, the Life of the world, ever abides in his heart, and he renounces sexual desire, anger and egotism. 602 : 264 The Lord is ever−present, permeating and pervading all places; the Name of the Infinite Lord is enshrined within the heart. 602 : 265 Throughout the ages, through the Word of His Bani, His Shabad is realized, and the Name becomes so sweet and beloved to the mind. ||2|| 602 : 266 Serving the Guru, one realizes the Naam, the Name of the Lord; fruitful is his life, and his coming into the world. 602 : 267 Tasting the sublime elixir of the Lord, his mind is satisfied and satiated forever; singing the Glories of the Glorious Lord, he is fulfilled and satisfied. 602 : 268 The lotus of his heart blossoms forth, he is ever imbued with the Lord's Love, and the unstruck melody of the Shabad resounds within him. 602 : 269 Raag Sorat'h − Part 008 37
